turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about RAF Kaldadarnes.
turn.2: RAF Kaldadarnes Royal Air Force Station Kaldadarnes or more simply RAF Kaldadarnes is a former Royal Air Force station, near the town of Selfoss, Iceland.
turn.4: The station was built in 1940 by the British Army and used by the Royal Air Force from March 1941 and throughout the remainder of the Second World War.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: On 2 September 1942 the war artist Eric Ravilious was lost after he flew from Kaldadarnes.
turn.8: After the cessation of hostilities of the Second World War the British Government handed the airfield over to the Icelandic Civil Aviation Authority and it was used for a short while until it was closed.
turn.10: It is now in ruins with the decaying runways, perimeter track, dispersals and site of some of the buildings still visible on satellite images in 2018.
turn.11: Is it open to the public to tour?
turn.12: There is a memorial to No. 269 Squadron RAF at the closest public access point, situated in the modern airfield of Selfoss.
